text: Tapan Raychaudhuri (8 May 1924 \- 26 November 2014) was an Indian historian. He was an expert in British Indian history, Indian economic history and the History of Bengal. He was a Reader in Modern South Asian History at University of Oxford from 1973 to 1992. He was also Fellow of St. Anthony College, Oxford from 1973-93 where he remained as an Emeritus Fellow until his death in 2014. Raychaudhuri died after suffering a series of strokes at his home in Oxford, England on 26 November 2014, aged 90.Historian Raychaudhuri passes away ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Indian writers Category:Indian historians Category:Indian academics
title: Tapan Raychaudhuri
